intro: Grewia mariannensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian grewia, is a small evergreen shrub native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant features simple, ovate leaves with a smooth texture and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruits are small, hairy capsules that split open to release tiny seeds. Grewia mariannensis is adapted to the dry, sunny conditions of its native habitat and is often found in coastal areas.
